values:
I made a new journal because I want to be cool like everybody else. It's called ElvenMist because I'm a dork. I don't know how to make it fancy where you can click on it and go there so you'll have to use your keyboards and type in the name. Sorry!

Love you all!
Cici

I'm lost. I'm surrounded by boxes and boxes of things that need to be shipped. I'm so organized in my planning, keeping list after list and checking things off one by one (you know my weirdness). But in all this organization, I'm lost. What am I doing? Where am I going? Why am I leaving the things that made me feel found? I needed a case for my many pieces of jewelry so I went rummaging through my room to find a box. I found this cherry wood case that had belonged to my parents or grandparents before it came to me. I can't remember what had originally come in the box, but I remember wanting it so bad. It was covered in dust now, having been shoved in the back of my closet for some time, since prom I thought as I wiped it clean. I opened it up and touched the soft crimson velvet with my finger tips. I smelled the same sweet perfume I had sprayed in there long ago, when it first came into my possession. This had been my time capsule. My precious moments box. It kept items from my favorite memories in it. There were four rocks -One was blue and white, shiny and smooth. It was bought by my mother and father for me in a small shop in Gatlinburg, Tennessee after much whining on my part. Gatlinburg, my second home. *Really, we have a house down there :-)* I spent so much time there when I was little. The arcades were so much fun, spending hundreds of dollars to get a twenty dollar stuffed animal. The hiking and shopping, occasionally seeing a bear. Every time we went I always rolled down the window and smelled the mountain air. Yes, it was just air...but it was different and pure. I loved that smell: trees, dirt, creatures, unknown things. :-) I loved it. -One black stone was there. Smooth and sleek, my mother had given it to me when we remodeled our basement years ago. I love that basement so much. It has been home to many favorite movies, a few parties, time with my dogs, roller skating with my sister, making movies of elves and witches, and being Ariel and Darcy Grant (A.K.A. the Little Mermaid and my made up character I pretended to be for so long). -The third was a chunk of fools gold I had stolen from my sister long ago. I don't think she ever knew it was missing. haha. I took it because I wanted something of hers. It was at a time when my sister and I weren't getting along too well. She was just too old and hip for a little brat like me. But I adored her, she was my idol (still is from time to time). So, to show my admiration for April, I stole one of her belongings...(how does that work out again?) But still, it was kind of cute of me. ;-) -The last rock was shimmering gold. My grandparents had given it to me when I was eight. It was from a trip they had taken to Maine. My grandmother had brought some back and given me one. (Thinking back on it, I asked for a lot of things...greedy little Cici) I thought of my grandparents. Wonderful people. For most of my childhood they lived in the house to the left of us on a big farm. I walked over to that farm all the time. I'd help my grandma clean out the manure from the horse stalls. I thought it was so cool! My grandpa was the first person to teach me how to ride. I was so little on this pony named Dusty. I can't imagine what my life would be like if he had never put me up on a horse. There was a little music box and a rose bud -The music box played "Can You Feel The Love Tonight" from the Lion King. I loved that song so much. I played that song all the time, I couldn't get enough of it. And I'm still trying to figure out why that song was so important to me, but nonetheless it still is beautiful. - The rose bud was from a dozen roses my Dad gave my Mom on one of their anniversaries. I love roses so my mom let me take one. When it began to die I cut off the top and put it in the case. I drenched it in perfume so it would smell nice. At the time it was overkill, but now it smells really nice. I guess I was a pretty smart kid after all. My parents have been wonderful to me. I have asked for so much from them and they have given all that they could. I mean, I had two horses, how many people can say they got to do that when they were a kid? Plus, I got to play softball and the horse. Every Wednesday after school I would drive to the barn. My mom would have already been there for an hour to turn my horse out and clean him up before my lesson. I never thought about it then but that is so important to me now. She cared about me so much to give up her time to watch me ride and help me take care of my horse. She drove me to shows, she cleaned my tack, she did everything I didn't want to do or couldn't do. How do you ever repay a person for something like that? My Dad was the same with softball. Every Monday he would drive me to my lesson and catch me (even with a sore knee). Every weekend he would leave home and go stay in a hotel for two or three days just to watch me play. And when I couldn't find a good team, he made one for me and became a coach just because he wanted me happy. He even took off weeks of work to drive hours and hours away for tournaments. And I would get so mad at him if he couldn't help me fix a pitching problem, when the whole time he was just being there for me. My parents put up with so much from me for eighteen years. I wasn't the best of children and I've had my moments when I really thought they hated me (with good reason). But they're my parents so they stood by me, through everything. Then the corsages -Two of them to be exact. One from prom, the other from another UA dance I can't remember. I remember I had tossed the one from prom into the box just before I took a long nap the day after prom. Ya know, they say that prom is either the worst day or the best day of your life up until then. But mine was just a day. It was a chance to be with the most wonderful friends I've ever had. It's hard to believe, but yes, I've had trouble making friends in the past. It seems that some people don't appreciate my honesty and find me rude and tactless at times (surprising indeed!). But the friends I have made at my years at Ursuline make me speechless. What can you say about the people in your lives that don't have to care about you like parents, but choose to because they are your friends? How do you tell them how important they are to you as you walk away from them to go to college and make new friends? How do you stay in touch? I don't know. But I know that no matter what, they will always be my fondest memory and I will remember them daily, because they are who I am. They formed me and molded me, right down to my accent and mannerisms. I love them all so much. Finally, a snip of black hair tied with a rubber band -It was horse hair. I had cut it out of Le Sabre's mane when we moved him to the barn in Kentucky. I wanted to have something of his close to me. Of all the wonderful things in my life, Sabre and Promise were the best of all (not to put anyone else down) but they were all mine. My babies. OH, how do I tell you how they changed me and how much I love them. I know that going away to college will be one of the hardest things I'll ever do, and that they'll be many challenges ahead of me. But nothing will ever be as hard for me and when I walked away from Sabre for the last time. I spent so many hours with that horse. He knew everything about me, more than I even know about myself. He was my hero, my best friend, my companion, mentor and student. He trained me just as much if not more than I trained him. I love those two horses more than anything in the world. And I still wish that I could go back and choose Sabre over everything else. I would give up everything to go back and ride him just one last time. Fly across the open field one more time, and jump a course again. Time heals all wounds, right? But it doesn't heal a hole in your heart that you try to fill but can't. God I miss them. And then I closed up the box and slid it back into my closet to get dusty again. Perhaps when I move out four years from now I'll find it again and remember all the things I remember now. I'm sorry this was such a rant. I didn't realize I would get this worked up. I love you all so much. Good night.

What will your last words be? by cum_on_bitch
Your LJ username
Your real name
Your sex
Your age
Your last words will be..."i hate you so much..."
Created with quill18's MemeGen!
Why does that just make so much sense? It's so me in so many ways and it's the first answer that came up. Ya know, I'll probably remember this and say it when I die just to make it write and tell my kids to call all of you and tell you that the livejournal quiz was right. Because I'm just that weird. :-) Cici

So I just watch the "Wade Robnson Show". What is up with that!? Why does he get this new dance show? Because she slept with Britney!? :-) Oh well, he's still pretty damn fine.

So I go to school in a week. Good Lord, so late from everyone else. I'm so nervous now that it's so close. What if I hate it? Ya know all the questions that you ask yourself before you do anything new. Ah well, I guess I just have to wait and see.

And yesterday I finally saw the Two Towers. It was unbelievable! Orlando Bloom is still the hottest thing I've seen in a long time. I love Legolas.
I just love The Lord of The Rings!

I talked to Molly the other day and she's in a sorority with Molly Bassano. She's really happy down there and hope she has a good time.

I'll talk to you guys all later
Bye!
Kisses!
Cici

Well, ten days and I'm off to Kentucky to start an accent and a smoking habit. :-) But seriously folks, I need to see you people before I go! I haven't been around my friends in way too long and now they're all going away...boo!

My roommate is telling me how she doesn't know if she has the right clothes for the winter time because it really doesn't get cold in Alabama and I'm like, well "we can go on a shopping trip for ya when the cold strikes". Yes, more shopping!

Well, my sis moved in to Miami today, there were a bunch of skanky freshman walking around the campus...yuck! And the other day I passed an eight year out in a croptop and booty shorts shopping with her mom....can people get anymore disgusting!? Eight year old whore walking through the mall! Ah! What is the world coming to. I think the government needs to enforce a dress code and I don't care if that's violating some ammendment, these people are making me blind!!!

Well, now that I've done ranting and raving, I'm going to leave you to get back to other livejournal entries. I'll talk to all of you soon enough.


Kisses,
Cici

I just got back from Jeff's house. It was nice to see him and a few people I rarely see like Jessie, Nate, Shane, and Matt Mauntel. I'm going to miss those random people that pop in and out of your life making it enjoyable. I spent two hours yesterday cleaning out my literal closet getting rid of clothing and toys I no longer need or want. It was nice to clear out the space, but a little nerve racking because I was going through my clothes thinking of which to take to college when. And then I got to wondering why college has to be such a big deal anyway...I mean, why do they decide that eighteen is a really good age for a person to move away from there home perhaps forever? Why? My mom told me today that I don't have to go if I don't want to, but I'd have to get a job and move out on my own somehow...so I decided to choose college. Bah! What a rock and a hard place that little situation is!

Ah well, there is no use in complaining about something I cannot control. And I'm sure I'll have a wonderful time once I get there, well, maybe not wonderful but good-enough-to-get-by-time. I hope all of you are happy in the decisions you have made.

I'll talk to all of you later.
Bye!
Kisses!
Cici

Well, I'm finally back from Gatlinburg. It was a pretty good trip with only a few minor interferences (Cooper). It was nice to get out of home for a little bit I guess, but I missed everything anyway. Molly left this morning for Clemson and I missed Anne's party. But hopefully there will be other things to do in the future. 

I bought swords in Gatlinburg! Yes, Cici has sharp pointy things! ::evil grin inserted here::. They are very pretty and replicas of the swords used in The Lord of The Rings! Aren't you all as excited as I am!? Shut up. They make me smile and my father is going to help me hang them on my wall so that I may kill intruders in the night. Yay!!

I just got back from watching Andy Roddick play in the Tennis Masters tourney right next to my house. He destroyed his opponent and advances to the finals. He's so damn hot. That's all I have to say about him...hot!

I head off to school September 3rd and am pretty much free up until then if anyone wants to cruise in the blazer. :-) I'll talk to you all later. 

Kisses
Cici

Hey all

So, I actually went to the SMOY fest this weekendgIot to see Traci and Anne whom I haven't seen in forever! They looked beautiful as usual. :-) The SMOY fest was, as expected, a complete bore, however, I was able to avoid EVERY person I was not wanting to see. 

Then, after the horrible evening at SMOY, Jacqueline and I went off to see Jeff at his house. He is doing well, if anyone would like to know. 

And now, I'm sitting in a chalet in Gatlinburg with my sis, JT, Cooper, and Paula. It's been a pretty good time, but I'm waiting for things to get ugly. I'll let you know when we get there. 

I'll write again soon everybody. Have fun enjoyihng the rest of your summer!

Hugs and Kisses!
Cici

Well, I've been in Kansas for the last week playing in the USSSA National tournament. It was a good time, but we have finally lost today. We did pretty well, our record is 3-4 and we beat out a lot of teams that we supposed to be better than us.

Tomorrow I leave for home and then off to school September 3. I'll talk to all of you when I get back. I miss you guys!

Cici

I watched "The Hours" today. I'd have to say I'm still trying to figure out exactly what everything means. If anyone has seen it, we should chat. Overall I'd have to say I liked it, although some of it was somewhat boring, but I guess that was kind of the point.

I have a softball game tonight in Indiana and this weekend I'm going to Fort Knox for a tournament. After that I have a weekend off and then I go to Kansas for the National tournament. My team is ranked 30th in the nation, which isn't that bad. :-) We're ranked 9th in the Greater Lakes Region (basically Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, Kentucky, and perhaps one or two other states, but I can't remember). 

I move into Centre College September 3. I do have a roommate which is kind of annoying, but she's a nice kid from Alabama. We'll see how that all works out because we all know how much Cici can't stand people for long periods of time. 

I'll talk to you all soon enough. Give me a ring during the week if you want to do anything. 

See you!

Cecil

Sometimes you realize you just have to get back to your roots and find your old livejournal you shoved in a corner for awhile. 

Well, I'm hoping to start using this thing more now that we'll all be off to college. We all need to stay in touch somehow and I fear I've been lacking in my end of the bargain. And so I'd like to say I'm sorry.

I watched Drumline today for the first time. I thought it was ok, but not as good as I would have liked it to be. It just seemed very empty and unmeaningful. Perhaps that's just me, it was still cute.

Well, if any of you don't know I finally got my own computer (so excited!) and it's really cool. It's obviously for college but I get to play with it for now. 17 inch flat screen with a printer/scanner and gigapocket (which means I can watch TV on it and decord TV to DVDs). I adore it!

Well, I'll stop boring you with my stupid life details and let you get back to your other, more interesting livejournal entries. I hope to be writing again soon. I'll talk to all of you later!

Bye!
Cici

Interesting...

In just a few days we will be walking down that aisle in our white dresses with our flowers in one hand and a laurel wreath upon our heads.....wait! Are we talking about graduation or one big wedding!? haha...It's like we're all getting married to the school. Everyone wearing their class ring and receiving their "marriage license" all together. Just the 135 of us and the school. How quaint. hehe.

But really, I'm excited to graduate. I think it will be really pretty and it shouldn't be all that long. And then we're all off to the thousands of parties we should attend afterward. :-)

Well ladies, I'll see you when I see you!

Have fun and remember to look pretty for your wedding day!

Love, 
Cecil Besil

Well, 
It's official, I'm finally done with school. Yes, I was probably the last of all of us, but I finally completed my last exam and now can sit back and relax for the rest of the summer! I'm excited!

Sheesh, another fangirl. Well, I dont blame you.
How can any woman resist a sexy body, and the
ruggedness that is Wolverine? Hes a loner by
nature, a heavy drinker, and is plagued by
memories of his past...or lack thereof. It may
take time to work your way into his heart, but
when you do, he'll do anything for his woman.
Just be careful, he has a tendency to stab
people in his sleep. ^_^;;

Who Is Your Ideal X-Men 2 Mate? (ladies only)
brought to you by Quizilla I just had to do it twice!

Oh what troubled lives we have when you have a converstation relating the size of breastases to niceness. It's even scarier when the conversation makes sense. :-D You know who you are that I'm talking to!

I love you all. 
Cici

Do you ever just feel like everything is crashing down around you and you can't do anything to stop it? That's how I feel when I look at what's left of my high school career. We have so few a number of days left to be together, and yet we spend them talking behind each other's backs and disliking everyone. One half of me just wants to tell the people that are idiots that they are being stupid and to get over themselves. The other half just says screw them, you'll never see them again anyway. What do you do when it seems like you're the only one that notices nothing is the same, and there's no time to make it change? 

I'd like to take a moment and tell all of you a little secret. High school is over this month. After June 1, 2003, we will never again travel through the halls of UA and chat about what are plans are for the weekend. That will be over, OVER! When you look back a year or two from now, I hope that you won't look back at yourself and wonder what the hell you were thinking. Don't let petty things stop you now. Friends don't last forever, cherish them now and remember what they've taught you in the future. 

When the year started I had the impression that senior year was going to be very special. But as I see it right now, I'm going to cry at graduation, but not because I'll miss everyone, but because I feel sorry for all the people who I know will regret what they see when they think back on this year. 

Life is too short to have regrets. Change now, or suffer longer. 
Pain heals, scars are lessons, lessons last a lifetime. I hope the lessons you have learned are happy ones.

And I hope I have left you with something that you can smile about. You all have made everyday I have gone to school an amazing adventure and each one of you means more to me than I can say. It hurts me to think some of you could leave feeling hurt by others. There is time to change, if you only start now.

Love,
Cecil

Hey kids!
Surprised to see my name? Me too, I was just strolling around online and decided to pop my head in and see how my old livejournal was doing. It sure has been awhile.

Well, let me tell you that I had so much fun at prom! It was everything I expected (which is good). In some cases it was better, and some it was worse, but it was one of the greatest moments of my life and I want to thank each and everyone of you for being a part of it. 

In this twisted thing called life you get a few chances to change everything you've known. In one split second you have the oppurtunity to live out something you've dreamed about for a long time. Do you take that chance or do you hesitate?.............I hesitated.

I love you all
Cici

Raver Bear

Which Dysfunctional Care Bear Are You?
brought to you by Quizilla Maybe it should say you should lay off the apple juice. hehe. I get soooooo hyper at school, but when I get home, I'm very mellow and quiet. My parents think I'm weird, my friends think I'm weird....but for different reasons....intriging (spell check) I have deep thoughts..... hehehe Love you all. Love your brother. Oops! hahaha Kisses, Cecil P.S. Don't be too afraid of me.

well,

It's been awhile since I've been here. I've forgotten what this place looks like. I think I've been too attached to my Sims game that I've forgotten everything else. haha.

I'm sure I'll be using this thing more often when I get to college and can't see you guys anymore. Can you believe that day is coming closer and closer. 

Ah well. I don't have much to say. I suppose I'll leave you to the rest of the entries. Jsut wanted to check in!


Love you all!
Cecil

Attachment. just another word and yet it means so much to people. Affection, feeling wanted and loved by the things surrounding you. Two words that just begin the list of feelings that every person feels. But what happened to pain? What if pain is the only word in your "emotional dictionary"? Have you ever felt pain? Real pain? The kind of pain you feel everytime you talk about something. And it makes you cry because you think of what you've done. The time of pain that makes you not able to look at yourself in the mirror anymore because you hate what you see? I have. Have you ever been jealous of someone just because you know their smile is real? Because they know absolutely nothing of what is inside your head? Because they haven't felt the failure that you endure everyday? That is pain. Do you look at people and no longer see human beings but see a picture of what you used to be? Do you see what you wanted to be? What you are? Do you stare in the mirror and wonder what the fuck you did wrong that you had to suffer like this? That is pain. Pain is real. Pain is mine. Pain is what I feel every waking minute, and there are many when you can't sleep at night because you dream of it, and so you scream about it. Pain is me. Besl You might think I'm exaggerating and quite frankly, I don't give a fuck. This is me, I give you truth. Take it or leave it.Youw at to leave some bitchy anonymous comment, go for it. You're free to do whatever the hell you want. Just know that you are a coward. You don't have the guts to tell me yourself that you have a problem with me because you know I'll give it straight back to you. I may not be pretty but I am real. This is how is it. This is my life. Deal.

My dad got a new lap top from his ofice so he gave me his old on. I get online in my room all the time now and talk and talk and talk. I think I talk too much. haha. Ah well. 

Exams are here once more and we all cram to learn everything not for life, but for the test. I hope everyone does well but doesn't hurt there heads too much. It is only a test, remember breathing is more important. 

I'm going to go study some more. I hope you all do well tomorrow and on all your exams. I'll talk to you all soon.

Kisses,
Cecil

Hey kids. 

Well, I'm tired! Molly just left my house after doing a Law project that just took too long. I'll be so glad when this week is done with and I'll be thrilled when exams are done with.

I think it's safe to say we all need a weekend right now!

I think I'm going to run off to sleep now. 

Talk to you tomorrow!

Cecil

Well, I hope everyone had a good New Year and has started the year off well. I believe my year will be the same as everyone before. I wonder if that's good or bad. 

Well, last year was full of interesting things. Junior AND senior year. Beginnings and ends. A lot of wonderful moments and things that we should never forget, but probably already have. I hope I can remember some of the moments that we have shared together. 

Love always,
Cici

Well...I'm bored. 

I'm glad everyone enjoyed my last post so much. It seemed to be very interesting there for awhile. Whatever...

Blah! I have nothing to do and Nikki and I are suppossed to go Ice Skating this evening but she won't get off her ass (she's on the phone with me) Nikki says Hi!

All right, I'm going to go try and find something to do so I'll talk to you all later.

Love you all!!

Cecil

Everybody says he wants me, then why o why is that not the case? ARG!!!

That's all I have to say about that. 

I want to go to another movie that never ends so I can sit their longer and be stupid with another stupid kid that I want to be seriously stupid with (did anyone get that?)

Ah well, life goes on...sometimes.

I'll check back with you all at another time.

Love always,
Cecil

P.S. I totally forgot my physics book at school and don't have any homework done and completely forgot until Rhonda called me and told me about it so if you guys see my scrambling for answers tomorrow, give me a hand please. Thanks so much!!

You're ice! You can be very cold and distant and you are NOT a people person. You're pretty mean but you can be nice...to a select few.

What element are you?
I told you I was the Ice Queen! And that was on my first try! Yeah!! Also, I'd like to say hello to Andrew since I just now put him on my friends list. And let him know that he is soooo cute (Anne knows why: PreCalc Class)! ::squeak:: So, yes....for everyone wondering Operation: Glitter Drop was a big success. The cars are so full of balloons you can't open the doors in the back and the stuffed animals are so adorable!! I just love being cute, even if you get nothing in return! Thank you guys so much for helping Nikki and I blow up the balloons. We really appreciated it and I'm glad you guys got a chance to write them notes. :-) I'm retaking my ACT's tomorrow, which sucks. But I'm hoping to improve my score more, even though OWU says I can get in with my score all ready. Whatever! If you want to chat this evening, I'm in for the night. Give me a ringy-dingy! Hope all of you guys are having fun doing whatever you're doing. I think I'm going to see if Jeff calls me about the cars. hehe.... It was one of the best things I've ever done in my life! Love you all (even Andrew)! Kisses, Cici

I'm sure many of you are grieving now. I am too. Some of us knew Mallory pretty well, some hardly at all. But we'll all suffer. The school will suffer, the world will suffer. Now I don't have all the beliefs all of you do, but I do believe in some things. And I know Mallory is out there somewhere, probably snorting and laughing right now, and I'm sure she's happy. I don't want to say too much, but I didn't want to say nothing at all. I'm going to miss her and I think the yearbook tribute is a great idea Julie. She would have loved to be a star in the yearbook. I want to leave with this quote:
"And we'll cry a little, Die just a little And maybe we will feel something we can't explain. But one day, we'll be able To once more be happy But for now, just cry a little, for her"
I love you all. ~Cici

Wow! I haven't been on this site in forever! Wonder I even remembered what is was called. haha. 

Well, Happy Thanksgiving to everyone! I hope you're all having a good time. My grandparents are coming over for dinner so my evening should be interesting. haha. I'm sure you're all going to have fun tonight, but don't get too fat!

The music trip this year is to Disney Land. But I'm not sure if I really want to go. The thing is I hate buses and Mrs. B has nothing planned out as of yet. The whole schedule she gave us was the one Mrs. Raine made freshmen year. She even calls Show Choir the mod squad! I'm not sure I want to go if Mrs. B is running the whole damn thing. 

Well, I'm off to play games at addictinggames.com. You should go there sometime, it is truly addicting!

Lots of love and Happy Thanksgiving!

Kisses,
Cecil

All things must come to an end. Good, bad or ugly the play is over and gone. We have to move on and go on with school and life. Hopefully we will never forget all the jokes, memories, and friendships we have gained. 

We had some ups and downs but remember that I love each and everyone of you. You're all amazing people and my life wouldn't be the same without you.

Love always and forever,
Carolyn

Do you know what I've decided, I'm SO tired of people talking about their lives and how kaotic their life is and how hurt they are and how much other people don't understand themand how other people have it easy compared to them and how hard it is for them to make it through the day without crying or how hard it is for them to live life without any real friends and I'm tired of everyone wanting sympathy for their mistakes and wanting someone else to take the blame for it and I'm so sick of everyone thinking that their problems are worse than anyone else's and that their problems mean something. They don't, they mean jack shit to the world and everyone better learn that real quick. 'Cause when you get out of college and you're on your own, you're gonna find out real fast that no one, not one solitary person gives a shit about your problems. They have their own problems to deal with and, in their mind, their more important than yours. "My friends don't like me." "I'm tired of everyone blaming me for thier problems." "Why does everyone hate me?" "This boy doesn't like me enough." "No one thinks I'm pretty." "My friend likes this guy that I hate so I'm mad at her." If you're not going to bother to listen to other people's problems, then don't expect them to listen to your own. I'm done.

Yes, well, Nikki S, Sally, Greg, John and I are sitting in room 404 waiting for Mr. B to need us at play practice. I'm very bored. We're supposed to be practicing lines, but we did that twice all ready so now John is talking about how Nikki set him up with Jenny Snively freshman year. It's a lovely topic, let me tell you. 

All right, moving on...the dancers are outside learning "Marian the Librarian" and it looks really good. The play seems to be going really well on the outside, but on the inside everyone seems to dislike or like one another more than they should. God Lord, what the fuck is wrong with people lately? Why can't anyone just be friends with the opposite sex, that's it!?

I don't have a lot of homework, ever, which means that I'm forgetting to do something incredibly important. That sucks, I know I have an English project and two Evil Essays due next Tuesday, but that's all I know.

Sabre's leaving to go to Kentucky soon. If I didn't tell you why don't ask me. I don't want to talk about it. You can ask Molly or Nikki. They'll let you know.

Well, John just asked, "What the hell happened to religion?" Don't get me started! I don't want to piss people off any more than I all ready have. Ah well, I'll just keep my mouth shut on this one.

I'm running out of things to say so I'm going to run off and talk to something else. I'll talk to you all tomorrow. 

Love always and forever,
Carolyn

P.S. ANNE: I talked to the principals and they said that they'll do our project no problem! AWESOME!! Bye baby!

Hey!

It's five o'clock in the afternoon and I just woke up after going to take a nap at 2:00. The sad part is I'm still tired. But it happens. I enjoyed my nap!

Softball games this morning; we won both and it was a lot of fun. Nikki Moeller is still a freak and Amanda Breyers showed up a little hung over (always a good thing). However, we managed to win, I don't know why.

My head itches.

How was set construction after play practice? What had been done so far looks really good. I remember most of that stuff from plays past :-)

Ah well, I'm going to have dinner soon and then run to the barn. I'll see you all tomorrow!!

Kisses, 
Cecil
Who ever knew one little essay could be so hard to write. Could cause so many feelings to stir. Who ever knew it would hurt this much?

Well, it seems that most of my time online is spent posting Sale ads for Le Sabre. I know it's the right thing to do. It is. But I'm still going to miss him.

The play is going along as it should be. But it's different this year. I don't know, it's not as homey and nice. It still seems that everyone is distant from everyone else. It's just not the same and I don't like it as much. Plus the drama is stupid this year. No Nikki scandals. Although I think the new Nikki (Nikki Moeller) is going to get herself into a drama screen with Lauryn if Nikki keeps talking to Phil. That will be and interesting fight full of tears and sorrow. Whatever!

I've given up on guys. I just can't seem to find the right one. And it's not that I even want a boyfriend (I mean, I do) but I also just want some guy friends. I haven't had those in forever. There's just something very different between a girl hugging you and a guy. A guy's hug is more protective. It makes me feel better. 

Ah well, life is life. I get to lead play practice Monday. Mr. B. won't be there and all and I'm completly in charge. This should be interesting.

Well, I'm off. I'll talk to you all tomorrow. Have a good evening kids! Love you all!

Hugs and Kisses,
Cecil

Well, the play is running smoothly. I'm happy about that, it makes my life easier. Except for the annoying people who don't show up to anything! That drives me crazy!!

I had a riding lesson today and it went really well. Sabre looks really good and everyone compliments him. It's sad that I'm selling him, but it's for the best. It's the best for me, really. He's just too damn strong for me (the main reason he's too strong is because my legs are too short) and that hurts. It hurts to know that I have made him so strong that I can no longer ride him. 
Someone at play practice Saturday told me I was short and I almost started crying because it made me think of Sabre. I always hated my short legs, and now I know why.

Ok...I have to go now. I just finished up working on my Spanish homework. I'll talk to you guys tomorrow at school. Have a good night kids.

Love you forever and always, 
Cecil

Lord I haven't seen this website in quite awhile! Sorry abou that, I've been rather busy with all that school crap. As are all of you, however.

Well, I'm pleased with the play so far. I'm glad to have the people that we have in the places they are in. Even if it displeases some people. 

My bruise is doing nicely, it seems to be healing however, which is sad because it's become a dear friend of mine in the week we've been together. haha. Yes yes, I am a freak!!

Ah well, I'll leave you now. Time to sign up for the second ACT test I will take. Just to get a better score. I swear you spend half your life in school, taking tests and stressing for nothing. At least that's my opinion. You learn all you need to know in Kindergarten and then outside school at social time. 

Talk to you all later.

Love always, 
Cecil

So...I went to the fireworks yesterday with April, JT, Cooper, Brandon, Lauren, and Anna. It was ok. Quite honestly it was incredibly boring and I slept for two hours. But we just had to get there at two to get good seats. Whatever! Mike was supposed to come but he didn't bother showing up because he ran into obviously more important friends than me. He can kiss my ass. At like 7:30 Lauryn, Traci, Molly, Nikki, and Dustin (Lauryn's brother) came and we all hung out for awhile. That made the fireworks more interesting than sitting in the sweltering sun listening to other people have conversations. However, by the time the fireworks started I was dehydrated and had a headache that practically made me blind. So when the booming began I had a real blast. It was awful. My sister drove me back up to Miami (I spent the night there) and I just went straight to bed. I felt awful and I still don't feel well. I think I have a cold that gives me the worst headaches ever! The fireworks were, however, pretty. But it's like I have a tradition to hate Mike during the fireworks. And I do hate him. I'm so mad at him right now I (yes, me personally) could spit (and you know how I feel about spitting)! Well, I'll stop ranting and raving now. I'll talk to you all later kids. See you tomorrow! Lots of love, Cecil

Well...life is going to be difficult for me for awhile. School isn't going to be easy for me, so if I appear to be stressed sometimes it's probably because I don't have enough time for my life. 

Since I've had all my classes now, let me explain to you what I think of all of them...

Pre-Calc - Mr. Slomer is the most annoying person on the planet! The long pauses, the rambling, laughing at his own jokes, etc.... I just can't take it. Plus he never gets around to teaching what we're supposed to learn.

Physics - I'm absolutely terrified of this class. I talked to my sis and she says Mr. Hetzel is really nice and helpful, but the class is just really hard. And well, put that on top of...

Spanish - I don't even remember this language and I'm taking it! What am I supposed to do? Hopefully I'll catch up but right now I'm working my ass off and it's getting me nowhere fast!

English - Perhaps a nice relief in the middle of a hectic day. I know this class is difficult (easier now that we have no vocab to study for) but I know Mrs. Nock and English has always been a really easy subject for me.

Evil in the Human Heart - Father Jack seems really nice, but he can't hear that well which bothers me when I'm bitchy so I'm afraid I'll get pissed at him or something. I hope this class will be pretty easy.

The Law and You - This won't be too bad, but it seems like it will have consistant homework every night which sucks.

Show Choir - This class actually went exceptionally well. Except for the fact that K.K. is a member, I'm very happy with all the girls (even Snivels) and how the dances look. Molly and Teeny are just amazing choreographers.


So that's my life for the next sememster of school! I'm going to freak. I think Spanish worries me the most because I feel so stupid, especially when I understand half of it but I just can't remember how to put it together in my mind. It frustrates the crap out of me!

I hope I don't get too bitchy with you guys, but I'm giving you fair warning right now. Because on top of all that school work I still have to ride my horse six days a week, play softball on Sundays, and director or act in the play. I mean, I couldn't make senior year any harder for myself if I tried!! Blah!!

I'll talk to you all tomorrow, if I don't explode!

Lots of love and luck on the new school year!!
Cecil

P.S. I really miss Mike. I mean, the kids like my best friend and he really makes me feel better because he tells me I can't get through this and I believe him. I wish he wasn't in Seattle, but he's happy because his job is great so I guess I should be happy for him. I just wish I could talk to him.

Hey! 

It's ten o'clock at night the day before school starts and what do you think Cici is doing? That's right...her summer reading. I have finished all the books, I'm just writing the papers and stuff. Tonight I'm answering all the questions because it says on this handout that that paper is not due until the second day of class. So I'm doing that tomorrow night. Yeah me!

Ah well, better get back to work then. Talk to you all tomorrow!

Later, 
Cecil

Show Choir Camp (SCC) started Tuesday and it is going really well! We're doing a medley from "My Best Friends Wedding" which contains "Wishin' and Hopin'", "Say A Little Prayer", and "The Way You Look Tonight". I really like the music and the dances are so cute!

So...I'm very happy with the way SCC is moving right now, but all ready tension might be growing in the ranks. A.K.A a person I shall refer to as K.K. has been rather annoying and messing up camp. Question after question after question gets really really really really really really really really annoying! But I'll get over it. We'll all have to get over it.

Well, school is starting way too soon for me. Goodness, in just a few days we'll be registering for one more year. Too soon, too soon!

Ah well, I'll talk to you all later. Sooner than we think I'm sure. Hope you have a good day. And just so you know, SCC will be having breakfast at Bob's tomorrow at 8:45 if you just want to stroll in by surprise. ;-) The Bob's near UA!

Talk to you all later!!

Hugs and Kisses,
Cecil

I saw Kathryn yesterday at Best Buy. She looked all spiffy in her shiny black shoes and her bright orange shirt! We both can't wait to see everybody back at school, but we don't want to take classes! 
Kat - We need to write silly poems in the computer lab like we did last year!! :-)

I'm starting to get nervous about my class load. 6.5 credits! Physics CP, AP Government, The Law and You, Spanish III CP, Show Choir (Ok, so this one isn't that much of an issue), Pre-Calc CP,  Evil in the Human Heart, Prayer and Spirituality, and English IV CP! OUCH!!!

But no complaining until school starts. That's my motto! haha

I'm off to eating and the good life. I'll talk to all of you later and I'll be seeing you soon!

Lots of love as always and forever, 
Cici

And far too soon the summer ends,
Soon we'll spend whole days with friends.
Laughing, learning, and all that stuff
Cheating, studying and a bunch more fluff.

And then one day the school day ends
And none of us need to go back again.
The last year done, we journey on
Knowing our memory will always live on

For deep inside every heart,
Fear of the future soon will start,
But if you just close your eyes,
You'll remember us and smile.

Never forget those happy days,
That you have created here at UA.


I love you girls! Remember that this is our last year and UA and time has just flown by. Never forget any face or any friend. I'll miss all of you so much! 

To the Class of 2003: May you always be happy and  loved. And if you ever feel lonely, just remember your days and UA and know that you are loved by all your classmates!

Love forever and always,
Carolyn Besl '03
